Summary: We walked in and walked out !!!!!!! That says it all .. it was dirty and smelled don’t know when it was really cleaned .  We asked for a queen bed and I’m sure it was just a full size . I’m all for a room just to sleep and get a shower but I wouldn’t do either one there.
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  We appreciate you taking the time to fill out our guest satisfaction survey after your stay in our hotel.  We are sorry to hear about your experience in one of our rooms, and thank you for taking the time to let us know about it. We've already let our housekeeping staff know so that they can take extra precautions to maintain everything in pristine shape.  We sincerely hope you'll give us another chance to serve you when you're next in town!  Truly, ES – Guest Relations Manager

Summary: If you are looking for a personal and enjoyable place to stay not overrun with other tourists you will enjoy your stay very much. The rooms are clean and the managers are nice. We stayed there in 1959 and really enjoyed our visit.
Room tip: nice pool and very close to the park

Summary: This has got to be one of the worst motel stays I've ever experienced in my 55 years of living. I'll start with the good first. The best thing about this place is its proximity to Disneyland.  The only other good things were the bed was comfortable, the water pressure and temperature were good,the air conditioner was old, but it worked, and the tv got a lot of channels. Oh, and the manager and maintenance man were nice.  Other than those things, this place is the pits!!!  While I was checking in, I asked the manager did they offer breakfast. He gave me a look that said, "You're only paying $200 for 2 nights, and you expect breakfast?"  He said something about $200, and said no, they did not serve breakfast.
